subject: RE: [junit] RecursiveTestSuite and reporting
msgSnippet: ... I just use the plain old ant/JUnit reporting stuff with RecursiveTestSuite, and it seems to work fine.  The tests spit out XML files which the test report
messageBody:
> Don wrote:
> > Currently I am using the ResursiveTestSuite in our build so
> that any
> > folder I am in I can build a testsuite from that folder and
> down. this
> > works fine, I am using ant build scripts and the <java> task to
> > execute it, I need to pass in args to set the path.
> >
> > What I would like todo is generate a report using the
> > RecursivetestSuite, does anyone have any idea howto do this in ant
> > script ?

I just use the plain old ant/JUnit reporting stuff with
RecursiveTestSuite, and it seems to work fine. The tests
spit out XML files which the test report generator sucks
up and builds a report out of. Both our continuous and
nightly builds use RecursiveTestSuite exclusively.

My testreport target looks like this:

<target name="testreport">
<junitreport todir="${dir.testresults}">
<fileset dir="${dir.testresults}">
<include name="TEST-*.xml" />
</fileset>
<report format="frames"
todir="${dir.testresults}" />
</junitreport>
</target>

I'm not sure if that's the missing link you're really
looking for. If not, contact me off-list and I'll just
email you my whole build.xml file. I don't think it
gives away any trade secrets or anything. :-)


> Can you use <batchtest> instead of RecursiveTestSuite? I find
> RecursiveTestSuite useful only when I have to run outside
> Eclipse and without Ant.

Hmm, I guess my mileage varies. I use RecursiveTestSuite
both from ant and from Eclipse, including using it from
ant inside Eclipse.


Todd.
